lead_paragraph: SLUTSKY--Eugene Harvey. A lifelong New York resident, Eugene was professionally known as Gene Harvey. He was a pioneer music promoter representing jazz and R&B luminaries in the 1970s and 1980s, but is particularly remembered for having fostered the singing career of Whitney Houston. He managed her career during the 1980s. Gene was a graduate of Rhodes and New York University, directing and producing films and local theater early in his career, and was a world traveler. Predeceased by his parents Sidney and Sophie Slutsky, Gene was loved and will be missed by his devoted companion, Ingrid Kvam, and her children Bruce (Pamela) Haskell and Brian (Dawn) Haskell, and by Gene's brother Edward (Pamela) Slutsky and nephew Andrew (Heather) Slutsky. Donations in his name can be made to The Lone Soldier at www.Israelforever.org. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  SLUTSKY, EUGENE HARVEY
